intro: Isoloma regelianum, commonly known as the Regelian star-of-Bethlehem, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and purple. It typically blooms in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch to gardens. Isoloma regelianum prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a versatile addition to shady or sunny garden settings.
